lead_paragraph: Legislation that propels the state’s minimum wage for all workers to the highest rank in the United States is headed to Gov. Kate Brown, who has said she will sign it.

headline.print_headline: Oregon: Minimum Wage Is Tied to Geography
headline.main: Oregon: Minimum Wage Is Tied to Geography

snippet: Legislation that propels the state’s minimum wage for all workers to the highest rank in the United States is headed to Gov. Kate Brown, who has said she will sign it.
abstract: Oregon House passes legislation that will raise minimum wage for all workers to $14.75 in metro Portland, $13.50 in smaller cities and $12.50 in rural areas by 2022; Gov Kate Brown has said she will sign legislation; tiered system based on geography is unprecedented in nation.
